trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux nxSshAuthorizedKeys Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux nxSshAuthorizedKeys Resource

trans-unit.source: The nxAuthorizedKeys resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage authorized ssh keys for a specified user.
trans-unit.target: The nxAuthorizedKeys resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage authorized ssh keys for a specified user.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: KeyComment
trans-unit.target: KeyComment

trans-unit.source: A unique comment for the key.
trans-unit.target: A unique comment for the key.

trans-unit.source: This is used to uniquely identify keys.
trans-unit.target: This is used to uniquely identify keys.

trans-unit.source: Ensure
trans-unit.target: Ensure

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the key is defined.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the key is defined.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Absent" to ensure the key does not exist in the user’s authorized keys file.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Absent" to ensure the key does not exist in the user’s authorized keys file.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "Present" to ensure the key is defined in the user’s authorized key file.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "Present" to ensure the key is defined in the user’s authorized key file.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: The username to manage ssh authorized keys for.
trans-unit.target: The username to manage ssh authorized keys for.

trans-unit.source: If not defined, the default user is "root".
trans-unit.target: If not defined, the default user is "root".

trans-unit.source: Key
trans-unit.target: Key

trans-unit.source: The contents of the key.
trans-unit.target: The contents of the key.

trans-unit.source: This is required if Ensure is set to "Present".
trans-unit.target: This is required if Ensure is set to "Present".

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example defines a public ssh authorized key for the user "monuser".
trans-unit.target: The following example defines a public ssh authorized key for the user "monuser".
